intro: Bobartia gladiata var. major, commonly known as the broad-leaved bobartia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its delicate foliage and modest blooms.
